content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Power Generation System
- Boiler at position (-2.0, 23.5)
- Steam engine at position (2.5, 19.5)
- Connected via pipes
- Small electric pole at position (6.5, 19.5)

###Science Production Setup
- Assembly machine at position (24.5, 4.5)
- Input chest containing iron plates (770) and copper plates (30)
- Output chest containing copper plates (380) and automation science packs (6)

###Research Lab Network
14 labs positioned at:
- (34.5, 6.5)
- (0.5, 8.5)
- (12.5, 8.5)
- (26.5, 8.5)
- (4.5, 12.5)
- (19.5, 13.5)
- (0.5, 16.5)
- (11.5, 15.5)
- (14.5, 16.5)
- (24.5, 16.5)
- (-4.5, 17.5)
- (15.5, 20.5)
- (19.5, 21.5)
- (22.5, 22.5)

ERROR TIPS

###Pipe Placement Errors
- Check for existing entities before placing pipes
- Clear the target area of any existing pipes or other entities before placing new ones
- Ensure there is sufficient space around the target location for pipe placement

###Electric Connection Issues
- When placing electric poles, ensure proper spacing between them (current spacing of 1 is too small)
- Verify that the entities you're trying to connect are within connection range
- Make sure the connection path between power poles and machines is unobstructed

###Resource Management
- Monitor coal levels in inventory to ensure continuous power generation
- Keep track of coal requirements for both boiler and mining drill operations

###Entity Placement Conflicts
- Before placing any entity, verify the target position is clear
- Remove existing entities that conflict with new placement attempts
- Use proper spacing when placing entities near each other

###Power Distribution
- Ensure proper power pole coverage to all machines requiring electricity
- Monitor power status of assembly machines and labs to maintain production
